intro: Mitrephora macrantha, commonly known as the large-flowered mitrephora, is a tropical evergreen tree native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Anacardiaceae family and is characterized by its glossy, elliptical leaves and clusters of fragrant, white to pale yellow flowers. The plant produces small, round fruits that are typically orange to reddish in color when mature. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and has potential uses in traditional medicine. Mitrephora macrantha thrives in humid, well-drained soils and requires a warm, tropical climate.
